properties.areaDesc: Henderson; Henry; McDonough; Putnam; Warren; Hancock; Bureau
properties.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 9 at 3:46PM CST until January 12 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Quad Cities IA IL
properties.description:
...Significant Winter Storm...

.A significant winter storm is forecast to impact the area over
the weekend with multiple hazards.

Precipitation will start out as all rain on Friday. As colder air
gets pulled south the rain will change over to freezing rain and
sleet Friday night into Saturday morning with significant ice
accumulations possible for parts of the area. The ice will change
over to all snow from northwest to southeast on Saturday.

* WHAT...Heavy mixed precipitation possible. Total snow
accumulations of 4 to 6 inches and ice accumulations of up to
two tenths of an inch possible. Winds could gust as high as 35
mph Saturday night. There will be a sharp gradient on snowfall
amounts.

* WHERE...Portions of north central, northwest and west central
Illinois.

* WHEN...From late Friday night through late Saturday night.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Drifting and some
blowing snow is possible.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Rain changing to freezing rain late
Friday night. Ice changing to snow late Saturday afternoon
before ending Saturday night.
properties.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH LATE SATURDAY NIGHT
